reference.shortdesc: The stepsection element contains expository text that might be rendered before a step.

section.title: Rendering expectations
section.p: Processors which render the content of stepsection elements among the step elements MUST NOT number the stepsection elements.

section.title: Specialization hierarchy
section.p: The stepsection element is specialized from li. It is defined in the task module.

example.title: Example
example.p: The following code sample shows how a stepsection element might be used:
example.codeblock: <steps> <step> <cmd>Get out a bowl.</cmd> </step> <stepsection>The next two steps are very important!</stepsection> <step> <cmd>Put on safety gloves.</cmd> </step> <step> <cmd>Put on goggles.</cmd> </step> <step> <cmd>Pour milk and cereal into the bowl.</cmd> </step> </steps>
example.p: The code sample above typically would be rendered with "Get out a bowl" as step number one, "Put on safety gloves" as step number two, and "The next two steps are very important!" as an unnumbered item in between the first two items.
